On 09/10/2010 11:36 AM, Eric J. Bowman wrote:
> The fact is, on an intranet, though "discouraged" by HTTP, alternate
> registries are possible without violating REST's self-descriptive
> messaging constraint.  The Web, however, only has one registry:  IANA.
>
> -Eric
>    

Are we making the distinction (between internet and intranet) or is the 
RFC and if its the RFC, which please?

Thanks.

--
